conclusion: The problem requires determining the output power of the power source when directly connected to resistor R, using the formula P = UI.
The graph shows the relationship between terminal voltage (U) and current (I) for the power source (line I) and the resistor R (line II).
The intersection of the two lines represents the voltage and current when the power source is connected to the resistor R.
The intersection point of the two lines on the graph is at U = 2V and I = 2A.
The output power P is calculated using the formula P = UI.
Substituting U = 2V and I = 2A into the formula, the output power is P = 2V Ã— 2A = 4W.
The output power of the power source is 4W.
